name: Los Alpes

reviews.text: Just returned from a four nite stay at Los Alpes. Located in a quiet, safe area of Quito...right across from the American Embassy. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. They helped me with email, finding offices that I needed to go to, etc. There are six computers that where you can check email, use the internet for a fee that is very minimal. Breakfasts were basic and good. Italian cuisine if you want it for dinners.
reviews.title: Los Alpes - Home Away from home

likes.disliked: — Things are a bit dated but ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were basic and fine...older bathrooms; but rooms had color TV, and were large. My room on the second floor had a lovely balcony. Lovely common areas with a firplace in the dining room which has a fire every evening. Good restaurants within walking distance. The owner, originally from Italy, is like a 'good grandfather'. Felt very much at home!
reviews.title: Friendly, well located mid-price hotel

likes.disliked: — Shop around for excursions, don't book them in advance, hotels like this can usually get things cheaper than going through big travel agents and have good local knowledge

reviews.text: We stayed for four nights as part of a trip around Ecuador. We'd been to the Galapagos on a previous occasion and stayed at this hotel at either end of the trip due to its proximity to the main tourist areas of the city. We promised ourselves that we would come back and explore this country better as we realised we missed out on so much. It was odd coming back somewhere after over ten years. In some ways the hotel hasn't changed much which made our visit all the more nostalgic. The rooms are comfortable, they haven't modernised the bathrooms but they were clean and worked. It still has plenty of character and the staff are friendly. We were disappointed that they no longer offered lunch but the breakfasts were good, a mix of European and US with eggs, meat, coffee, bread etc. It was useful that they had internet access, at the same price as internet cafes but more convenient. They locked away valuables at no charge and made us feel very welcome in their comfortable and quiet hotel.
reviews.title: Quaint but not amazing

likes.liked: — Quiet and off the main drag

reviews.text: Hostal Los Alpes is not a 5-star boutique hotel. It is, however, a beautiful, quiet, and quaint hostal in downtown Quito, a couple blocks from the Swissotel and directly across the street from the US embassy (landmarks are good, as the taxi driver had difficulty finding it). It is on a quiet street and is set back in some trees and bushes, providing ambience before you even enter.
reviews.title: Agree with previous reviewers

likes.liked: — friendly atmosphere, location, price, Internet access

reviews.title: Lovely small hotel
reviews.text: The staff are exceptionally friendly and very helpful, and the owner and most of the staff speak passable to fluent English.

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after returning from the Galapagos and found that most of the praise about this hotel from other reviewers are true. I had stayed at a different Quito hotel before my Galapagos trip and the Los Alpes was a much nicer place. Wi-Fi internet connection was fast and worked well in my 2nd floor room. The satellite TV offered many English-speaking channels. If you get the craving for some fast-food, McDonalds and KFC are just a few blocks away. The Ecovia bus line is also really close and it only costs 25 cents to go to Old Town or to La Mariscal.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I made reservations at Los Alpes by emailing them through their website. After receiving a confirmation email from Claudio the owner, followup emails from me went unanswered. Because of that, and the fact that he hadn't taken any information to hold our reservation, I wasn't sure what to expect. When we arrived at 10 pm we were greeted by name and escorted to the rooms I had requested. We paid $70 a night for a suite with two bedrooms and tile bath upstairs, and a sitting room and kitchenette on the main floor.
reviews.title: A quiet retreat in Quito

likes.liked: — Liked the atmosphere, location, cleanliness, friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Los Alpes to be clean and "homey", the desk clerk happy to help us. We left money and personal belongings in their care while we enjoyed our trip to the Galapagos, and found everything to be fine on our return.
reviews.title: The friendliest hotel in Quito

likes.liked: — The homely atmosphere and comfortable bed

reviews.text: The included breakfast was good, though nothing elaborate. The one night we ate in their restaurant it was apparently too late (8pm)- we were served tasteless bowls of pasta for $8.
reviews.title: Los Alpes was good value; Safe, Clean & comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay at Los Alpes again, but would eat a late supper elsewhere.
reviews.title: A real gem of a hotel
An "okay" place to stay except......
reviews.text: Some things about Los Alpes are fine --- it's quiet, there's a restaurant on premises that's okay, and the staff is pleasant.. Nothing fancy, but adequate. One needs a taxi to get to the historic center; and the front desk is happy to call one for you.
The only problem I had was when I left a locked suitcase in the hotel's
reviews.title: A lovely hotel
Los Alpes is a quiet sanctuary
reviews.text: "secure" room while traveling south for a week. I made the mistake of thinking that the items would be there when I returned-- and most things in the suitcase were. What wasn't still there was my cell phone, I-pod, and Bose headphones. The front desk manager said that the hotel was sorry for the losses.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I said, my mistake.
reviews.title: Great Value in Quito
Home away from home
reviews.text: We booked directly after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and found the hotel to be just as nice as people described. The staff were indeed helpful and made us feel much more like guests in their house rather than customers. The comfortable communal areas added to this effect with their ornaments and paintings. Our room was huge by European standards. It was clean and cheerful with its own bathroom and balcony. We tended to eat out at night as we wanted to explore the city but ate in the restaurant one night and enjoyed the food and the company of guests from the US and Europe. The hotel is very close to the popular restaurants and bars but tucked away in a quiet residential road near the US Embassy. All in all we would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

reviews.title: Great staff, so-so facilities
reviews.text: If your top priority is a friendly, homey atmosphere, this is your place. As others have said, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.
The hotel itself feels like your rich old grandmother's house--some will find it quirky and charming, others will find it cluttered and outdated. The rooms are definitely a little run down.
reviews.title: A true gem

reviews.text: The staff were very accomodating and helpful to the point that they comped many things, i.e. drinks, phone, etc.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
the best
reviews.text: Our rooms were extremely unique and very large. We stayed there on two separate occasions during our travels throughout Ecuador. Both rooms were spacious with hallways inside them, interesting paitings and decor. They were really more like suites. The rooms were clean and the building was very comfortable. There were little courtyards throughout the property and it was in a safe area. This hotel was one of the nicest surprises I've encountered on my travels.

Stayed here 2 nights, the lobby interesting , old with all kinds of paintings and iron. People very kind, we had the airline (United in the States) lose a bag and the staff called the airline number and followed up in the morning. Lovely little breakfast room, Rooms were the problem, clean but run down. The carpet had definitely seen better days and the bathroom had cracked tile. TV didn´t work until staff unpluged the cable and reconnected it. It´s on the outskirts of the Marasel area, good resturants a walk. So good people, so so rooms. Price was reasonable. For about $ 8 to 10 more, stay at the Hotel Vieja Cuba.
reviews.title: Not bad

description: Los Alpes has been providing a warm welcome in the heart of Quito for thirty years. The hotel is in an excellent location for tourists and business travellers alike. Breakfast is included and there is free access to the internet using the hotel's computers as well as by a wireless connection. All rooms have a television and a telephone as well as an en-suite bathroom or shower. The communal areas include a sunny balcony with views across the city and a seating area next to the restaurant where our guests can warm themselves by a real fire in the evening.
